description.narrative: (i) Support for SMEs: IFC experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. IFC would support job creation in Turkey since Mediterra's midcap growth strategy is in full alignment with IFC's development impact goals. (ii) Access to long-term equity/risk capital is limited in Turkey. SMEs usually access short term bank loans in the absence of equity investors. IFC's investment would support Turkish companies by providing liquidity and depth. (iii) Private Sector Development: Mediterra will employ a hands on, value added strategy with portfolio companies. Through this knowledge sharing, new management techniques and growth strategies are incorporated by investee companies, leading to improved competitiveness and sustainability. (iv) The Fund will seek to make investments in Anatolian cities where SMEs are often underserved for equity capital.

Mediterra Capital Partners I, LP (the Fund) is a closed end private equity fund that will make investments in small to midsized private Turkish enterprises. The target fund size is 200 million, and the first closing of 100 million was held on May 27, 2011, therefore the final closing is on May 27, 2012 (with a potential 6 month extension subject to LP Advisory Board approval). The Fund expects to make 10 to 15 investments in various sectors, including: retail, education, healthcare, industrials, automotives and logistics. Approximately 60-70% of investments will be in Istanbul and Marmara, approximately 30-40% will be in Anatolian cities, where SMEs are often underserved for equity capital. The Fund will allocate a minimum of 20 million, or 16.7% of its commitments (whichever is greater) to SMEs.
